Interest Points

Generate Interest Points and captures complexity within the landscape.

Sample points from set of points, weighted according to their salience and captures the time-varying configurational complexity of interest points within the landscape, generating a 2D Histogram of IPs.

Authors:

  • Giuseppe Boccignone <giuseppe.boccignone@unimi.it>

  • Renato Nobre <renato.avellarnobre@studenti.unimi.it>

Changes:

  • 12/12/2012 First Edition Matlab

  • 31/05/2022 Python Edition

Type

2D histogram of IPs for visualization.

Type

np.array

N

Number of sampled points.

Type

int

Number of samples in the 2D histogram.

Type

int

num_bins

Number of bins in the 2D histogram.

Type

int

max_points

Maximum number of points to sample. Value is set in config.py

Type

int

landscape_sampling

Landscape sampligling flag. If True, sample also from the landscape. Value is set in config.py

Type

bool

interest_point_sample(num_proto, proto_params, saliency_map)[source]

Sample Interest points from proto-objects and/or from the landscape.

Control the sampling of interest points. If there is no proto-objects, sample only from the landscape. If there are proto-objects, sample from both if self.landscape_sampling is True, otherwise only from proto-objects.

Parameters

  • num_proto (int) – Ammount of proto-objects.

  • proto_params (obj) – ProtoParameters object.

  • saliency_map (np.ndarray) – Frame saliency map.

Returns

Vector of XCoord and YCoord

histogram_ips(frame_sampling, sampled_points_coord)[source]

Create representation of IP as an Empirical Distribution.

Parameters

sampled_points_coord (np.array) – (N, 2) array containing data points coordinated.

Returns

  • histmat (nd.array) – 2D histogram array (rows represent X, columns represent Y)

  • num_samples (int) – Number of sample points in the 2D histogram

  • num_bins (int) – Number of bins in the 2D histogram

_proto_objects_sampling(proto_params)[source]

Sample points from the proto-objects.

Parameters

proto_params (obj) – Sampled proto parameters for the frame

Note

Update self.xCoord and self.yCoord with the sampled points

_landscape_sampling(saliency_map, only=False)[source]

Sample points from the landscape.

Note

Update self.xCoord and self.yCoord with the sampled points

Parameters

  • saliency_map (np.ndarray) – Frame saliency map

  • only (bool, optional) – Flag indicating if we are only sampling landscape or if the data will be appended to other previously sampled points. Defaults to False.

_boccignone_ferraro_ip_sampling(saliency_map)[source]

Boccignone-Ferraro’s backend function for the IP sampling method.

  1. Sample Interest_Point.Max_Points points from set of points weighted according to their salience

  2. For each sample, set scale by drawing from uniform distribution over Interest_Point.Scale

Parameters

saliency_map (np.ndarray) – Frame saliency map

Returns

  • xCoord (np.array) – X Coordinates of IPs

  • yCoord (np.array) – Y Coordinates of IPs

  • scale (np.array) – Scale of points (radius, inpixels)

_get_points(salience_map)[source]

Extract salient points from the saliency map.

Parameters

saliency_map (np.ndarray) – Frame saliency map

Returns

  • yy – Y coordinates of salient points

  • xx – X coordinates of salient points

  • strength – Saliency strength of salient points
